As a person of faith, I wish President-elect Donald Trump nothing but the best as he becomes the Commander-in- Chief of our Nation.   On November 8th 2016, many of us were deeply wounded and it was a very difficult time.  For me, the concern was for so many of my constituents who had worked so hard for a different result; and the many young people who were for the first time engaged in the democratic process that were seemingly so disappointed.  They were looking for hope.  After the election, although still very concerned, I was willing to give the President-elect the appropriate time, as he moved through his transition, to address the American people with a message of unity.  Unfortunately, the transition was not as smooth as I believe many of us, as Americans, would have wanted it to be.  The call for unity and the embracing of all Americans simply did not come.  The moments of attack continued.  However, many of us still continued to listen.    As a senior Member of the Homeland Security Committee and Ranking Member on the Judiciary Subcommittee on Crime, Homeland Security, Terrorism, and Investigations, I take national security very seriously.  I was appointed to the Homeland Security Committee in the aftermath of the heinous, murderous, and horrific terrorist attack on September 11, 2001.  The intelligence community is part of my day to day work.    In the midst of moving toward the inauguration, stark, provocative, sobering, and difficult facts came to our attention.   All of America’s intelligence agencies confirmed the detrimental cyber-attack by high Russian officials, including President Vladimir Putin, to steer the election toward one candidate, Mr. Trump, and away from the other candidate.  Rather than accept their report, President-elect Trump chose to make a full force attack on the brave men and women serving in our intelligence community and disparaged their commitment to serving our nation.  There are moments in a public official’s life that you always put country over self.  That did not happen and the disappointment was piercing. As a Member of the Judiciary committee, one of my proudest moments was the reauthorization of the Voting Rights Act of 1965. But an even prouder moment was the enormous number of votes the legislation received from both Republicans and Democrats in the House and Senate.  And when all the Members went to the White House for the signing of the legislation by a sitting Republican President, we celebrated America’s love affair with the precious right to vote.  President George W. Bush signed that legislation into law only to now come to 2016 to face huge examples across the nation of voter suppression in this election with newly minted laws that suppressed the voting rights of so many Americans and particularly many in minority communities.  The President-elect gave these voting abuses no credence.  Further, the President Elect has every right to select his or her cabinet. However, it is very difficult when his choice for the nation’s highest law enforcement officer, who is supposed to be the arm of justice for the most vulnerable in our nation, and that person holds consistent positions against civil rights and against voting rights.   So, I deliberated on my decision over a period of time.  I am not boycotting this ceremonial inaugural event.  I have decided in good conscience I cannot go!  John Lewis, a man who bled for freedom made his choice and made his decision without rancor or hysteria. But that was not the tone of the response he received; and John did not call for any boycott!  This is not a boycott!  This is an act of conscience! The President-elect could not refrain from a full-fledged personal attack on Congressman John Lewis.  He failed to offer even a small olive branch.   The State of the Union will be the President’s first message directly to Congress and the American people on how he will lead – that I will attend – and I am committed to working for my constituents and all of the American people.  I hope the new President will do the same!  So my principles revolving around justice and fairness, an unfettered election, the duty that I have to the national security community and the recognition of the provocative and criminal intrusion by the Russians into our election causes me to be reflective on January 20.  Finally, I did enjoy greeting my constituents as they came to the inauguration.  But as so many Americans, I will be waiting on that olive branch to be extended to all of us by this President; thereby giving us an opportunity to heal, to mend, and for him to recognize that Americans have very similar aspirations and values, and to remember that those who did not vote for the ultimate victor still deserve dignity and respect in this country!  #inauguration

Washington, DC - Congresswoman Sheila Jackson Lee, a senior member of the House Committee on Homeland Security, former Chair and Ranking Member of its Subcommittee on Transportation Security, former Ranking Member of the Homeland Security Subcommittee on Border and Maritime Security, and current Ranking Member on the Judiciary Subcommittee on Crime, Terrorism, Homeland Security and Investigations, issued the following statement in response to President Trump’s executive order banning Muslims from seven countries from entering the United States:    “As Americans we are best when we are true to the values we hold dear, beginning with fidelity to the Constitution and the laws of the United States. The executive order issued last Friday by President Trump is a radical departure from these principles and I call upon him to rescind this order immediately   “I went to Bush Intercontinental (IAH) Saturday evening to inquire into the status of a person being detained there even though the person had lawfully entered the United States, had complied with all legal requirements and had done everything by the book but nevertheless was being punished by President Trump because his religious faith was Muslim.   “I applaud the order issued by U.S. District Judge Ann Donnelly of the Eastern District of New York temporarily enjoining the Trump Administration from, in any manner or by any means, removing individuals with refugee applications approved by U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services as part of the U.S. Refugee Admissions Program, holders of valid immigrant and non-immigrant visas, and other individuals from Iraq, Syria, Iran, Sudan, Libya, Somalia, and Yemen legally authorized to enter the United States.   “The American Civil Liberties Union has been fighting on behalf of the detainees who have been held at New York City’s JFK Airport since Trump’s executive order banning Muslims from Iran, Iraq, Syria, Somalia, Sudan, Yemen, and Libya took effect.   “The stay issued by Judge Donnelly preserves the status quo and will protect passengers who arrived in the United States from those countries currently being detained at JFK, Dulles, Philadelphia, Atlanta, San Francisco SFO, LAX, DFW, Houston, and Chicago-O'Hare from being deported back to their countries of origin. It is unclear as of this moment whether they can be released.   “JFK, Dulles, Miami, Newark, LAX, SFO, and O'Hare airports are considered the major entry points for refugee flights (though other categories of legal entrants such as green card holders could come into other airports).   “On Friday, January 27, President Trump signed an executive order that suspended resettlement of Syrian refugees indefinitely, suspended all other refugee resettlement for 120 days. The order also imposed a 90 day ban on entry of nationals from Iraq, Syria, Iran, Sudan, Libya, Somalia, and Yemen, each of which is a predominately Muslim country. There is little reason to doubt that the motivation behind the Trump executive order was to exclude persons of whose religious faith is Muslim. The executive order is simply a ban on Muslims posing as a measure to protect the homeland.   “The executive order went into effect immediately and so did its destructive intent. At John F. Kennedy International Airport last night, Hameed Khalid Darweesh arrived and was immediately detained.   “Darweesh worked as interpreter for the Army’s 101st Airborne Division and, according to Brandon Friedman, a platoon leader in Iraq, saved countless U.S. service members’ lives.   “There is no way to know for certain how many other refugees and foreign nationals with green cards or visas have been detained.   “I thank the ACLU and other non-governmental organizations that went to work immediately to challenge the constitutionality of the executive order and for their success in winning a temporary stay of the order which prohibits the Trump Administration from taking action to deport the refugees and immigrants currently being detained.”   ###   Congresswoman Jackson Lee is a Democrat from Texas’s 18th Congressional District. Congresswoman Sheila Jackson Lee Introduces USA Values Act to Protect Religious Liberty and Stop Trump Administration From Denying Humanitarian Relief To Refugees Lawfully Entitled to Enter The United States    Jackson Lee: “I have introduced the USA Values Act (H.R. 735) which will invalidate the President’s discriminatory Executive Order which has the effect and intent of excluding persons whose religious faith is Muslim from entering the United States. My USA Values Act affirms our nation’s core beliefs regarding religious freedom and equal protection and treatment under law.”     Washington, D.C. – Congresswoman Sheila Jackson Lee, a senior member of the House Homeland Security and Judiciary Committees today released the following statement after introducing H.R. 735, the Universal Security of American Values Act of 2017 (USA Values Act), which will invalidate the discriminatory Executive Order issued by the President banning visitors and refugees from certain countries from entering the United States simply because they exercise their right to religious liberty by adherence to the Muslim faith:     “The United States of America is a country founded by persons escaping religious persecution and freedom of worship has been a bedrock national value since the Pilgrims landed on Plymouth Rock in 1620. It is no coincidence that the first of the amendments comprising the Bill of Rights protects inviolate the free exercise of religion.     “Neither the Constitution nor the First Amendment recognizes an exception to the free exercise of religion in the case of persons of the Muslim faith. The executive order issued by the President last Friday is discriminatory Executive Order because it has the effect and intent of excluding from the United States those persons from predominately Muslim countries whose religious faith is Muslim. This is the type of invidious discrimination that our Constitution, laws, customs, and traditions do not countenance.     “That is why I have introduced H.R. 735, the Universal Security of American Values Act of 2017 (USA Values Act of 2017), which declares the Executive Order issued by the President on January 27, 2017 to be null and void and of no force and legal effect.  In addition, USA Values Act prohibits the issuance or implementation of any Executive Order that has the effect of abridging religious liberty or any of the privileges and immunities guaranteed under the Constitution or laws of the United States.     “As Americans we are best when we are true to the values we hold dear, beginning with fidelity to the Constitution and the laws of the United States. The executive order, which represents the President’s attempt to make good on his pledge to impose a ban on Muslims from entering our country,  is a radical departure from the values, principles, and practices that heretofore have made America the envy of the world.     “Former president Barack Obama ‘fundamentally disagrees with the notion of discriminating against individuals because of their faith and religion.’ The former president is right, the current president is wrong and I call upon the President to rescind this discriminatory order immediately.”     “Arbitrarily excluding Muslim visitors to our country will not make us safer and makes a mockery of our reputation as the world’s most welcoming nation. The USA Values Act, which affirms the nation’s core values, complements the ‘Statute of Liberty Values Act’ (SOLVE Act), which bars ethnic and religious discrimination against refugees that was also introduced today by my colleague, Congresswoman Zoe Lofgren of California, and sponsored by me and more than 125 Members of the House.”                                                 ###     Congresswoman Jackson Lee is a Democrat from Texas’s 18th Congressional District. She is a senior member of the House Committees on Judiciary and Homeland Security and is Ranking Member of the Judiciary Subcommittee on Crime, Terrorism, Homeland Security and Investigations.

PRESS RELEASE CONGRESSWOMAN SHEILA JACKSON LEE TAKES STRONG STAND AGAINST MASS DEPORTATION THAT VICTIMIZED JOSE ESCOBAR AND HIS FAMILY   Washington, DC – Congresswoman Sheila Jackson Lee, a senior member of the House Committees on Judiciary and Homeland Security and Ranking Member of the Judiciary Subcommittee on Crime, Terrorism, Homeland Security and Investigations, expressed outrage over the sudden and unjustified deportation of Jose Escobar, which occurred despite her office’s intervention in the matter and despite the reassurance from local ICE officials that Mr. Escobar would not be moved.   “Immigration officials acted callously by tearing this married father away from his small children and loving wife.  Mr. Escobar, who has no history of trouble with the law, is a hard-working family man whose slice of the American dream has become a nightmare because of the current Administration’s ill-conceived mass deportations”.   Since 2012, Mr. Escobar was living with his family in Houston on a deferred status, which the Congresswoman helped secure following his detention by immigration officials in late 2011.  Under the terms of his status, he was required to check-in with immigration officials annually.  And that’s what he was doing when he was detained by ICE agents on February 22, 2017.   Representatives for Escobar contacted the Congresswoman’s office, which immediately took steps to prevent his deportation.  The Congresswoman was given assurances by local ICE officials that Mr. Escobar’s deportation was on indefinite hold while efforts to reunite him with his family continued.  But despite these assurances, he was precipitously deported to El Salvador on Thursday, 3/2/2017, and sent back to a country he hasn’t seen for more than 15 years.   ”Based upon the re-interpretation of the Executive Order and immigration goals by the White House, where the focus is on criminal and gang leaders as opposed to a father with a spouse and children who are United States citizens, Mr. Escobar should not have been deported”.   “This morning, I sent a letter to the Secretary of the Department of Homeland Security seeking emergency intervention and a full review and reopening of this case.    “At a time of unprecedented divisions in America and with much work needed to bring this country together, I’m strongly opposed to these sweeping deportation measures.  The new DHS implementation guidelines on deportations are tearing at the fabric of our communities, and hard-working law-abiding immigrant families like the Escobars have paid an unconscionable price, one that we cannot allow to continue.”

Press Conference  STOP THE TRUMP BUDGET…SAVE MEALS ON WHEELS   Congresswoman Jackson Lee: “The Trump budget wages assault on America’s generous soul and threatens to strip away the nation’s social safety net from those who need it most.”   Houston, TX- Congresswoman Sheila Jackson Lee is fighting to save crucial social service programs that are at risk of being slashed or gutted as part of the draconian cuts laid out in the Trump Budget.   Houston’s Meals on Wheels program could see a major scale back in operations causing many seniors and other vulnerable members of the community to go without food.   On Sunday, March 19, 2017, the Congresswoman held the “Stop the Trump Budget, Save Meals on Wheels” press conference to draw attention to the devastating impact the Trump cuts could have on working families by gouging huge holes through America’s social safety net.   The Congresswoman who serves on the House Budget Committee was joined by officials from Meals on Wheels along with other local and county leaders.   Jackson Lee: “These cuts are immoral and would devastate the most vulnerable members of our community who have already suffered enough.  We must stand together to fight for American values and say “no” to the Trump budget.” These budget cuts are attacking our nation’s most vulnerable citizens at both ends of the age spectrum.  While some seniors face the prospect of going hungry, at risk youth will see the after school and summer programs they rely on slashed by $3.7 billion.  In addition, the federal work study program would be dramatically scaled back adding an extra financial burden on college students struggling to make ends meet.   The Trump budget would also eliminate the Federal Supplemental Educational Opportunity grants or SEOG.  In Texas alone, 67 thousand students received $41 million in these grants last year.   The Trump budget would strip $3 billion from the Community Development Block Grant program and take $35 million dollars in funding away from Section 4 Community Development and Affordable Housing programs.  And it slashes 500 million dollars from the WIC program, which provides food and nutrition to low-income pregnant women and lactating moms and their kids.   Jackson Lee:  “This budget shows no compassion for people at the low-end of the financial spectrum.  Instead, it takes money from those who need it the most and awards it to those who need it the least.  It runs counter to our most fundamental beliefs and principles that as Americans, we’re only as good as how we treat the most vulnerable among us.”

FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE                                            Contact: Rucks Russell April 17, 2017                                                                                           202-225-3816   Press Statement Congresswoman Sheila Jackson Lee Calls on President to Release Tax Returns at Houston’s Tax Day Protest   Houston, TX – Congresswoman Sheila Jackson Lee, a senior member of the House Committees on Judiciary and Homeland Security and Ranking Member of the Judiciary Subcommittee on Crime, Terrorism, Homeland Security and Investigations called on President Trump to release his tax returns at Houston’s Tax Day Protest, one of more than 150 that took place at cities across the country last weekend.  “We demand that the President of the United States do what every President since Gerald Ford in 1976 has done and that is to release his tax returns while in office,” said Jackson Lee in remarks she delivered to the crowd assembled on the steps of Houston City Hall on Saturday, April 15th.    Mr. Trump is the first President since Watergate to refuse to release his tax information to the public.  A full release of Trump’s tax returns will provide the public with clear information as to his potential conflicts of interest and entanglements with foreign governments and businesses.  A recent Washington Post-ABC News poll found that 74 percent of Americans, including 53 percent of Republicans, believe Trump should release his tax returns.  Jackson Lee: “As chief steward of America’s extensive domestic, global and national security interests, the fidelity of the President of the United States to the national interest must never be subject to question or doubt.  Trump’s extensive financial interests in more than 100 companies operating in more than 18 countries and on five continents potentially represent mayor conflicts of interest between his personal financial interests and the national interests of the American people.” A preliminary analysis of Trump’s extensive financial arrangements reveals dozens of potential conflicts of interest.  For example, Trump has received more than $10 million from his interest in the Trump Towers Istanbul in Turkey, a country with which the United States has extensive, complicated and politically sensitive military and diplomatic relations.  “Since August 2015, Trump’s business organization has registered eight separate companies connected to hotel deals in Saudi Arabia, which is located in one of the world’s most critical geopolitical regions.  Based on the limited and inadequate financial disclosures he has made to date, it appears that Trump’s business organization is financially dependent upon, and obligated to Deutsche Bank, its biggest lender, which happens to be negotiating a multibillion-dollar settlement over housing-crises-era abuses with the Justice Department, a deal that will be finalized with Justice Department officials appointed by Trump.  “The American people are entitled to assume without hesitation or doubt that when the President of the United States meets with foreign leaders and dignitaries that he is motivated only by what is in the national interest and not the private, pecuniary interests of himself, his family members or his business enterprises.  “As the Scriptures teach, you cannot serve two masters.  Trump must make a choice.  Either he should release his tax returns and divest all of his financial interests or relinquish the office he holds do to his inability to take care that laws be faithfully executed and to preserve, protect and defend the Constitution of the United States.”  ###   Congresswoman Sheila Jackson Lee is a Democrat from Texas’s 18th Congressional District.  She is a senior member of the House Committees on Judiciary and Homeland Security and is a Ranking Member of the Judiciary Subcommittee on Crime, Terrorism, Homeland Security and Investigations.

It is our responsibility in Congress to listen to all sides and try and find solutions to restore trust in our criminal justice system.   Houston, TX – Congresswoman Sheila Jackson Lee who serves on the Policing Strategies Working Group or PSWG, which was established to examine police accountability, aggression towards law enforcement and public safety concerns related to these issues, hosting a bi-partisan congressional delegation in a tour of several Houston detention facilities and high-level meetings followed by a press conference on April 20th, 2017.   Members of the PSWG have been traveling to cities around the country as part of a fact-finding mission to address matters surrounding law enforcement.  Jackson Lee is delighted the group accepted her invitation to include Houston in the on-going study.   “Houston is our nation’s 3rd city and as such welcomes the opportunity to host this group of national leaders on the issue of police community relations,” said Jackson Lee.  “It is imperative that we identify strategies to strengthen relations and build trust between members of law enforcement and the people who rely on them.”   The PSWG includes Representatives Bob Goodlatte (R-VA), John Conyers (D-MI), Trey Gowdy (R-SC), Doug Collins (R-GA), Dave Reichert (R-WA), Susan Brooks (R-IN), Will Hurd (R-TX), Sheila Jackson Lee (D-TX), Hakeem Jeffries (D-NY), Cedric Richmond (D-LA), Keith Ellison (D-MN) and Robin Kelly (D-IL).   Among those invited to take part in the tour and closed-door discussions include Houston Mayor Sylvester Turner, Houston Police Chief Art Acevedo, Harris County Sheriff Ed Gonzalez, Harris County District Attorney Kim Ogg, Metro Police Chief Vera Bumpers and community activist Quanell X.   According to House Judiciary Committee Chairman Bob Goodlatte, “It’s clear that more must be done to end excessive use of force, strengthen police accountability, prevent violent attacks on law enforcement and improve the relationship between police officers and the communities they are sworn to protect and serve.  I am pleased that members of the Policing Strategies Working Group will be traveling to Houston to meet with community leaders and local law enforcement to discuss how they have addressed these challenges.”   Congressman Conyers, the ranking Democrat on the House Judiciary Committee, says finding ways to improve relations between police and the public is an extremely high priority.   “Chairman Bob Goodlatte, Congresswoman Sheila Jackson Lee and I have been working to pursue a bipartisan strategy for both policing and criminal justice reform for the last several years,” said the Congressman Conyers.  “Despite the current political climate, it is necessary that we continue an open dialogue on building trust between law enforcement and the communities they serve. I look forward to our discussions with local law enforcement and community leaders in Houston as we kick off our first Policing Strategies Working Group meeting of 2017.”

I will vote no to Proposition 1.”  Washington, DC – Congresswoman Sheila Jackson Lee, a senior member of the House Committees on Homeland Security and Judiciary, and Ranking Member of the Judiciary Committee’s Subcommittee on Crime, Terrorism, Homeland Security and Investigations, issued the following statement about the upcoming vote on Proposition 1 demanding the Houston Independent School District and Harris County tax payers refund Texas almost $80 million:  “First I want to thank members of the Houston Independent School Board who vigorously fought state legislators, the governor and the Texas Education Agency in opposing the state’s arcane and discriminatory school funding system that unfairly hurts children in majority minority school districts.  These kids have become victims of a process that syphons valuable tax dollars from much needed programs and thus diminishing their educational opportunities.  “I believe the state of Texas funding structure for K through 12 public education is unjust.  I will vote no to Proposition 1 that forces the Houston Independent School District to return to the state almost $80 million of Harris County tax dollars that was intended for the education of our children.  “We have been through similar fights before.  Years ago I supported the lawsuit lawyers filed on behalf Texas Southern University and other historically black colleges accusing their states of discrimination with respect to funding practices.  The U.S. Department of Justice Civil Rights Division worked with me to settle the case forcing Texas to fund TSU.  The order is still active and was cited in 2016 and 2017 when Texas was found to be in noncompliance.  “I believe that the U.S. Department of Justice and Department of Education’s Civil Rights Divisions need to challenge the State of Texas on its broken school funding process and the TEA’s intimidating order against HISD.  “Finally, I look forward to working with the community and school board members who fought valiantly against this attack on our children’s education.  I thank them for their efforts.  As a member of the United States Congress, I intend to seek relief under Federal Civil rights laws to protect our children from this blatant and reckless discriminatory funding process which undermines the opportunities for innocent children.    ###  Congresswoman Sheila Jackson Lee is a Democrat from Texas’s 18th Congressional District. This week's #FeatureFriday is none other than ABC13-Chauncy Glover, and here's why:   You could call three time Emmy Award winning journalist, Chauncy Glover a real Southern Gentleman. He was born and raised in Athens, Alabama and has worked on air in Alabama, Georgia, Florida, and Michigan. The 31-year-old is the newest face of KTRK- ABC13 Anchor Team. Chauncy was bitten by the News Bug quite early. In fact, his father built him his very own "anchor news desk" at the age of 6! That's where Chauncy "anchored" his news shows every Sunday evening after church for his family and friends. It may have been all fun and games for Chauncy's "viewers" at the time, but he was serious about television news. He later turned his hobby into a career. He went on to study Broadcast Journalism, Music and Theatre at Troy University. He also has a degree in Public Relations. He graduated at the top of his college class and was awarded the Sydney Sullivan Top Senior Award, which is an honor given for academic excellence, forwardness in faith and campus and community involvement. Chauncy started his TV career two days after graduating college, landing his first reporter job at WTVM News Leader 9 in Columbus, Georgia. After a two-year stint there, Chauncy packed up and headed for the Sunshine State. Chauncy joined Action News CBS 47 and Fox 30 in Jacksonville, Florida. There he was a special projects and General Assignment reporter. Chauncy left Florida’s sunny beaches to brave Michigan’s snowy winters in December 2011.He joined the Local 4 News team in Detroit Michigan as a Reporter/Fill-in anchor. He reported for one of the top-rated shows in the country--Local 4 News at 11. From local news to national news, Chauncy has covered the big stories. While at Local 4, he covered the Sandy Hook Massacre in Newtown where he landed an exclusive interview with the teacher who was in the classroom next to the one where the massacre took place. Chauncy also reported live from Cleveland as three women held in captivity for ten years were freed. But there’s one story that Chauncy covered in Detroit that he says he’ll never forget. He was sent on breaking news to a school where two students had been shot by a coach after they tried to rob him. One suspect was found wounded and rushed to the hospital, but the second one was nowhere in sight until Chauncy stumbled upon the young man lying in the street. He had been shot in the chest and was clinging to life. Chauncy tried to help but it was too late.  After witnessing the teenager die on the streets of Detroit, he went back to Martin Luther King Jr. Sr. High School and created a mentorship program for young men. “The Chauncy Glover Project” is a hands-on, extensive mentoring program that grooms teenage boys into upstanding gentlemen. The program focuses on dressing for success, manhood, etiquette, college readiness, tutoring, public speaking community service and more. While anticipating the 501c3 status, Chauncy funded the program himself. The CGP mission is, “To empower, encourage and inspire young men to become strong, moral and confident leaders of society.” CGP is proud to say it has sent more than four dozen young men to college with scholarships and the program has expanded to Houston--where CGP is mentoring 30 young men.  Chauncy has won several awards for his work, being recognized by the Associated Press, National Association of Black Journalist’s Angelo B. Henderson Community Service Award, MTM Unsung Heroes and many more. In 2013, Chauncy won his first Emmy for Best On-Camera Talent- Live Reporter. In 2014 he was nominated for three Emmy’s, in the Best Spot News, Best Continuing Coverage and Best Reporter Live categories, in which he brought home two Emmy’s, for Best Spot News and the other Best On Camera Talent-Live Reporter. He was inducted into the prestigious (MOE) Men of Excellence in the fall of 2014. Chauncy was also named one of the Ambassadors of The Year for his work with the youth of Detroit. He was among Madonna, Mary Barra and five others to receive this coveted honor. As a professional TV Host and actor, Chauncy has traveled the world in productions, but his proudest moment was being asked to honor the late civil rights activist Rosa Parks, by singing at her funeral in Montgomery, Alabama. A sought after motivational speaker, Chauncy spends a lot of time traveling and delivering riveting speeches across the country. But he always finds the time to serve. Chauncy serves in the National Association of Black Journalist, National Broadcasting Society, Abstinence In Motion, Men of Standard, The Arts Council, Troy University Alumni Association and the National Reading Alliance. He's also a proud member of Alpha Phi Alpha Fraternity Inc. Chauncy lives by the three F’s---Faith, Family, and Fitness. His life motto is “Fear stops where Faith begins.”  Join me in celebrating one of Houston's most dapper, and dedicated, and devoted men Mr. Chauncy Glover. Press Statement Privatizing the Nation’s Air Traffic Control System may put our commercial aviation at Risk   Jackson Lee: “The Myth that the Private Sector does a better job than the Federal Government is not born out by history including what occurred on September 11, 2001 when private airport screening at airports did not stop 19 hijackers.”   HOUSTON, TX – Congresswoman Sheila Jackson Lee, a senior member of the House Committee on Homeland Security and former Chairwoman of the Transportation Security Subcommittee released the following statement about the Trump Administration’s plan to privatize air traffic controllers during a press conference at George Bush Intercontinental Airport in Houston:   “Sixteen years ago, our nation witnessed the depth of darkness in our skies and the height of heroism amongst those entrusted to keep the flying public secure.  As hijacked aircraft began their heinous and unthinkable assault, air traffic controllers had little time to act. “At stake were the lives of the nearly 1 million passengers on more than 5 thousand planes that were either over or fast-approaching North America on that September 11th morning.  After United flight 77 crashed into the Pentagon, the FAA declared that all planes be grounded, an order that had never been implemented before.  And yet, through improvisation and seasoned professionalism, controllers managed to safely land all 5 thousand flights.  They were heroes one and all and yet to this day, most of their names remain anonymous.  That’s just what they do.  “Air traffic controllers are essential to commercial aviation security and to the security of Americans.  The proposal just announced by the Trump Administration to privatize the air traffic control system raises serious questions regarding security at our nation’s airports. This proposal needs to be thoroughly vetted by all relevant Congressional committees including the Homeland Security Committees of both the House and Senate. “Today, I join representatives from TWU, AFSCME, IBEW 716, Paul Puente of the Gulf Coast Building and Construction Trades council, and with the President of the National Air Traffic Controllers Association who has said the status quo is unacceptable but has vowed to oppose any reform proposal that would institute a for-profit model.  He has also laid out the following conditions that any reform proposal must meet:   protect the rights and benefits of the workforce ensure that (security) and efficiency remain a top priority provide a stable, predictable funding stream that adequately supports air traffic control services, staffing, hiring and training, long-term modernization, preventative maintenance, and ongoing modernization of the physical infrastructure maintain service to all segments of our nation’s diverse aviation community.   “Today, I remain concerned that privatization would lead to mass firings and the degradation of the work conditions crucial for maintaining the viability of the air traffic control system.  “Air traffic controllers have begun to use next generation technology.  Since 2007, Congress has provided approximately $7 billion for NextGen with the goal of full implementation by 2030. Any private company that assumes control and management of the system should surpass the technology controllers currently have in place.  “Legislative efforts to privatize air traffic control may require the FAA to giveaway traffic control facilities and equipment necessary to conduct air traffic control system. This was the approach of Shuster’s Bill last Congress. Neither the federal government nor any auditing authority has assessed the value of what they may plan to give to the entity that might be assigned management of air traffic control. “The Department of Defense and the FAA collaborate in many ways to assure a seamless system of air defense and civilian air travel security.  Following September 11, 2001 this coordination has been a mainstay in assuring another attack does not happen.  There is no experience for the DoD to follow should it be required to coordinate with a private entity in the way has done with federal agencies for domestic defense. “Congress has authority to delegate authority or power to a federal government agency or private entity, but it is not clear whether the Constitution allows Congress to delegate power to a for-profit or non-profit entity.  The proposal that the administration now offers is that of a failed attempt by Republicans to move such a plan through congress. “Last Congress, Chairman Shuster introduced a FAA reauthorization bill that would have privatized the Air Traffic Control system. During committee consideration of the bill all Democrats and two Republicans opposed it.  Although the bill made it out of committee it did not advance to the floor due to strong bipartisan opposition.  The bill was never voted on. “A historic change of this magnitude impacting the defense and security of our nation has to be bipartisan. “The FAA provides service to over 15.5 million aircraft each year. The total number of aircraft managed by all other nations is 12 million combined. The security of our nation is too crucial than to take a chance on privatization at a time of rising terrorism. “I fear the ultimate goal of the President’s plan is to issue a big check to one of his corporate friends. “We cannot allow that to happen.  The security of Americans is at stake.  And the 15 thousand dedicated men and women who manage more than 87 thousand flights daily across the U.S., deserve more.  Air traffic controllers weren’t just heroes of 911.  They serve heroically every day.” “Today, I stand for national security and for the security and expertise of the men and women who serve as FAA air traffic controllers.”

Press Statement  WITH TEMPERATURES SOARING, CONGRESSWOMAN SHEILA JACKSON LEE AND THE 18TH CONGRESSIONAL DISTRICT DELIVER HOME HEAT RELIEF FOR THE MOST VULNERABLE IN HOUSTON    Jackson Lee: “We should never risk the lives of seniors, children and people with chronic illnesses who are most at risk for health-related complications in Houston’s extreme heat.”   Houston, TX –Today, Congresswoman Sheila Jackson Lee, a Senior Member of the Homeland Security Committee, has partnered with the Community, local companies and a number of non-profit agencies to launch her annual “Beat the Heat” initiative which provides air conditioners to seniors, the families of vulnerable children and other vulnerable populations endangered by Houston’s extreme heat.   “Increasingly high temperatures increase health risks and make air conditioning a necessity for elderly residents,” said Congresswoman Jackson Lee.  “It is important to provide preventative measures like these air conditioners in the midst of the extreme heat in Houston’s summers to avoid health complications and possible death from these extreme weather conditions.”    Houston ranks among the hottest cities in our nation.  According to forecasts, over the next two weeks Houston’s scorching temperatures will average in the mid to upper 90’s. Next Monday and Tuesday for instance, the forecast calls for highs of 98 degrees, followed by 95 degrees on Wednesday.   It is particularly life-threatening to be in homes without any form of air conditioning because those homes become extremely heated to the point of near suffocation in some instances.  Just last August, a husband and wife in their 60s died from heat expositor in their North Houston home because of no air conditioning.    For more than 20 years, the Congresswoman has worked closely with local non-profit organizations to distribute and install air conditioners for those who are most at risk.  “This helps to ensure that our residents remain cool during our sweltering summers,” added Jackson Lee.   Children typically spend the most time out in the sun without replenishing their fluids, and doctors say that they, and the elderly, run the greatest risk of developing mild heat illness.  Prolonged failure to treat mild heat illness can lead to more serious conditions like heat exhaustion or even death by heat stroke.  For the elderly, factors such as fragile health combined with an extremely high heat index contribute to the rising number of fatalities.  However, socioeconomic problems such as poverty, isolation, and substandard housing in communities with high crime and low business or social centers have a tremendous impact.  Experts say as the weather gets hotter, it becomes more difficult for the human body to shed heat. Normally, heat flows from the human body into the atmosphere, but when temperatures rise above 100 degrees, the body’s natural cooling system reverses, and heat flows from environment into the body. At this point, another cooling mechanism usually kicks in: sweating. But in hot, humid places, like Houston, sweat does not readily evaporate, preventing the human body from dissipating heat and cooling down.  Texas averages 68 heat-related deaths per year.  In Houston alone, hundreds of heat-related illnesses are reported annually. “We cannot sit idly by and allow the elderly, the poor and the very young suffer or become part of these statistics,” said Congresswoman Jackson Lee. Many of them are still waiting for home inspections and need answers regarding the appeals process and how best to utilize Home Inspection Teams.   “I am calling on FEMA to create a new app to provide homeowners with instant status updates on the inspection process,” said Congresswoman Jackson Lee.  “This app should speed up the process of scheduling FEMA inspectors for a home visit if your home has not been inspected in more than 10 days. This will help the many who are struggling to get their lives back in order.” This week, FEMA announced the creation of a new housing program under the Direct Housing Assistance Program, which allows FEMA disaster relief funding to go to individual homeowners or to local governments to provide housing.  To be considered for this program, people must first register with FEMA at www.DisasterAssistance.gov. Local government immediate disaster assistance housing options are as follows: Multi-Family Lease and Repair: • Direct assistance to repair or improve existing multi-family housing such as apartments in order to provide more housing for survivors. • Properties must be three or more units, with each unit providing complete living facilities for cooking, eating, and sanitation. Hotels, motels, and extended stay hotels are not eligible at this time. Direct Leasing: • Direct Leasing: Enables local governments to lease a property that typically would not be available to the public, such as corporate lodging. • Local government enters into the lease agreement on behalf of individuals or households. Various types of housing properties may be eligible. Manufactured Housing Options (Mobile Homes and Recreational Vehicles): • Direct housing places manufactured housing units on private land or commercial pads. • Local permitting may apply. • Site must be suitable. Hauling and installation included. • An inspection of the site to determine suitability will be scheduled. Partial Repair and Essential Power for Sheltering (PREPS): • PREPS provides minor repairs to homes in locations with limited housing options. • For eligible properties that have incurred limited damage displacing individuals from their homes. • PREPS provides basic, emergency home repairs - not to include finish work. Direct Assistance for Limited Home Repair: • Program provides partial repairs to homes with significant damages. • Program can include partial repairs to a damaged home where alternative housing is not available or is not cost-effective. • FEMA will determine eligibility for permanent housing construction on a case-by-case basis. • All other forms of housing assistance must be exhausted before the program can be considered. Some Hurricane Harvey survivors are getting an extension to stay temporarily in hotels while they look for an alternative place to live.  October 14 is the new checkout date for the Transitional Sheltering Assistance (TSA) program, which pays for short-term hotel stays.  All applicants for FEMA recovery assistance have the right to appeal if they are dissatisfied with FEMA’s determination letter. All appeals must be in writing and explain the reasons why FEMA’s decision may not be correct. The appeal should include any documentation that FEMA requests or that supports your claim. And I thank METRO for providing shuttles to transport storm-impacted Houstonians to and from the Deussen Park Site.  Together, they made it work and as a result, thousands were served on Wednesday, October 18, 2017.”  Houston, TX – Congresswoman Sheila Jackson Lee, a Senior Member of the House Committees on Judiciary and Homeland Security, issued the following statement about the enormous need and response to the Disaster Supplemental Nutritional Assistance Program or D-SNAP:  “I am saddened that an elderly gentlemen who traveled to Alexander Deussen Park seeking the aid that he deserved lost his life.  My deepest sympathies and prayers go out to his family.  “At the start of the three day extension for D-SNAP in Harris County, I witnessed firsthand the plight of Hurricane Harvey survivors who were forced to endure extreme hardships to secure the benefits they so desperately need.   These were men and women, including seniors and the disabled, who are hurting and struggling to get back on their feet.  “Many of them suffer from one or more of the following hardships:  • Lost or no access to income; • Home or business repairs; • Temporary shelter or evacuation expenses; • Home or business protection expenses; • Cost to replace personal or household items; • Clean-up expenses; • And personal injury, including funeral expenses.  “With these added expenses, food support is very important.  That is why they came to the emergency D-SNAP processing site at Alexander Deussen Park, to submit applications for food assistance.    “The site, which is located 22 miles northeast of downtown, has only one lane leading in and one lane leading out. In her 23rd consecutive year hosting the event, the Congresswoman called the turnout indicative of the enormous needs of the community following the devastation of Hurricane Harvey.  “Scores of Houstonians lost their property, their belongings, and in many instances, their jobs,” said Congresswoman Jackson Lee.  “Some parents attempting to rebuild have had to stretch their budgets just to put food on the table and have had little opportunity to purchase toys for their kids.  “That is what made this year’s toy giveaway such a welcome and timely event.  We received a record amount of donations which enabled us to bring comfort to storm-weary families and bring smiles to children’s faces.”  “None of this would have been possible without the tireless work of the many volunteers and organizations who gave their time, energy and resources to this worthwhile endeavor.”

Statement from Congresswoman Sheila Jackson Lee regarding incident on recent flight from Houston to Washington, D.C.:  “I am disappointed in having to respond to this accusation, but I believe transparency is very important.  Unfortunately, it looks like Grinch is trying to steal the spirit of the holiday.  Last Monday, I arrived at the airport to catch my flight to Washington to continue my fight to get Hurricane Harvey funds back to Texas and other hard hit areas, along with funding of the Children’s Health Insurance Program and of course, trying to stop a tax bill that was going to cause millions of Americans to lose their health insurance.  After receiving my boarding pass, I boarded the plane in the normal process.  I did nothing wrong.  I asked for nothing exceptional or out of the ordinary and received nothing exceptional or out of the ordinary.  I proceeded to take my seat and work on legislative issues on my way to Washington.   Although I was not involved, I observed a disruption by an individual walking back and forth in the cabin.  I could overhear her speaking with a flight attendant (an African American woman).  I saw the gate agent go to the seat of the individual who was walking back and forth before we took off.    I later came to understand that the individual had canceled her own flight.  However I had nothing to do with that.  I noted that this individual came toward me and took a picture.  I heard later that she might have said “I know who she is.”  Since this was not any fault of mine, the way the individual continued to act appeared to be, upon reflection, because I was an African American woman, seemingly an easy target along with the African American flight attendant who was very, very nice.  This saddens me, especially at this time of year given all of the things we have to work on to help people.  But in the spirit of this season and out of the sincerity of my heart, if it is perceived that I had anything to do with this, I am kind enough to simply say sorry.  I understand the airline is working to address the passenger’s concerns.  I am glad of that.  But as an African American, I know there are too many examples like this all over the nation. I hope one day, we will accept our collective diversity.  Happy Holidays.”

We must take a stand to protect innocent life and push back against the deadly scourge of gun violence.  Houston, TX – Congresswoman Sheila Jackson Lee, a senior member of the House Committees on Judiciary and Homeland Security and Ranking Member of the Judiciary Subcommittee on Crime, Terrorism, Homeland Security and Investigations, will host a news conference and march in response to the deadly shooting at the Haverstock Hill Apartments last Sunday.   The event will begin at 12:30pm, Sunday, 4/2/2017, at SonRise Community Church located at 5609 Mount Houston Road in Northeast Houston.  Following remarks at the church, Pastor Edward M Buford, residents of Haverstock along with local and federal members of law enforcement will join the Congresswoman in a march to the Haverstock Hill Apartments, located at 5619 Aldine Bender Road.  Should rain become an issue, the group will drive to Haverstock as opposed to marching.  One week ago, an argument erupted in gunfire that left two people dead and four others injured.  Among the injured was Brandy Rusher, a former contestant on America’s Next Top Model.  The Haverstock Hill Apartments has a long history of crime problems.  In 2010, law enforcement responded to more than 3,000 calls leading the county to file for its first ever gang injunction.  The temporary order was made permanent four years later when a judge banned dozens of accused gang members from a “safety zone” that included Haverstock. The suspects in last Sunday’s shooting have both been apprehended but for the victims and their loved ones, justice may seem hard to find.  “It’s tragic that we should even have to hold events like these,” said the Congresswoman.  “But we must take a stand to protect innocent life and push back against the deadly scourge of gun violence.”
